column4: can you get a list of available kernel modules? I want to find one for my wireless card
modprobe -l
that shows active modules? or installed ones? or just what's in /lib/modules? I mean can i see a list of modules from ubuntu servers that i can install?
it show modules available, used modules to list "lsmod"
either install packages containing new modules, a new kernel-package or build modules yourself
right, so where's the list of packages containing new modules, so i can install the right one?
what exactly do you miss/need/want?
read here for info http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1600498
ok, will read that - i found some on that forum before using google but didn't understand it - I was hoping for something like install package called xxx then it will work :D
I tried to install that before and it said that the package doesn't conform because it has binaries in an architecture independent package, so ubuntu refused to install it
try dpkg --force-architecture                but that might break things, be carefull
I have the rt2860sta module :) must have been something I did yesterday to install it - now to make it work
sudo modprobe rt2860sta
will it load by default? should i add that to a config file?
1st check if it loads and works. if it does, add "rt2860sta" to /etc/modules to make sure it'll be loaded at boottime
ok, thanks a lot for your help - i think i am on the right track now :)
try "lsusb"
two integrated rate matching hubs and two root hubs in lsusb - nothing else. the camera is a built-in one on this laptop, so i'm trying to figure out the model
was just a guess since my netbooks camera is usb :) sry cannot help
haha - to make the webcam work, just needs to be turned on with the fn+F6, that was easy
:D
life can be soo easy
